verses.verse: For <WG1063> we know <WG1492> that <WG3754> if <WG1437> our <WG2257> earthly <WG1919> house <WG3614> of this tabernacle <WG4636> were dissolved <WG2647>, we have <WG2192> a building <WG3619> of <WG1537> God <WG2316>, an house <WG3614> not made with hands <WG886>, eternal <WG166> in <WG1722> the heavens <WG3772>.

For <WG2532> <WG1063> in <WG1722> this <WG5129> we groan <WG4727>, earnestly desiring <WG1971> to be clothed upon <WG1902> with our <WG2257> house <WG3613> which <WG3588> is from <WG1537> heaven <WG3772>:
If <WG1489> so <WG2532> be that being clothed <WG1746> we shall <WG2147> not <WG3756> be found <WG2147> naked <WG1131>.

For <WG2532> <WG1063> we that are <WG5607> in <WG1722> this tabernacle <WG4636> do groan <WG4727>, being burdened <WG916>: not <WG3756> for that <WG1894> we would <WG2309> be unclothed <WG1562>, but <WG235> clothed upon <WG1902>, that <WG2443> mortality <WG2349> might be swallowed up <WG2666> of <WG5259> life <WG2222>.

Now <WG1161> he that hath wrought <WG2716> us <WG2248> for <WG1519> the selfsame thing <WG846> <WG5124> is God <WG2316>, who <WG3588> also <WG2532> hath given <WG1325> unto us <WG2254> the earnest <WG728> of the Spirit <WG4151>.

Therefore <WG3767> <WG2532> we are always <WG3842> confident <WG2292>, knowing <WG1492> that <WG3754>, whilst we are at home <WG1736> in <WG1722> the body <WG4983>, we are absent <WG1553> from <WG575> the Lord <WG2962>:
(For <WG1063> we walk <WG4043> by <WG1223> faith <WG4102>, not <WG3756> by <WG1223> sight <WG1491>:)

We are confident <WG2292>, I say, and <WG1161> <WG2532> willing <WG2106> rather <WG3123> to be absent <WG1553> from <WG1537> the body <WG4983>, and <WG2532> to be present <WG1736> with <WG4314> the Lord <WG2962>.
Wherefore <WG1352> we labour <WG5389>, that <WG2532>, whether <WG1535> present <WG1736> or <WG1535> absent <WG1553>, we may be <WG1511> accepted <WG2101> of him <WG846>. labour: or, endeavour

For <WG1063> we <WG2248> must <WG1163> all <WG3956> appear <WG5319> before <WG1715> the judgment seat <WG968> of Christ <WG5547>; that <WG2443> every one <WG1538> may receive <WG2865> the things done in <WG1223> his body <WG4983>, according <WG4314> to that <WG3739> he hath done <WG4238>, whether <WG1535> it be good <WG18> or <WG1535> bad <WG2556>.

Knowing <WG1492> therefore <WG3767> the terror <WG5401> of the Lord <WG2962>, we persuade <WG3982> men <WG444>; but <WG1161> we are made manifest <WG5319> unto God <WG2316>; and <WG1161> I trust <WG1679> also <WG2532> are made manifest <WG5319> in <WG1722> your <WG5216> consciences <WG4893>.

For <WG1063> we commend <WG4921> not <WG3756> ourselves <WG1438> again <WG3825> unto you <WG5213>, but <WG235> give <WG1325> you <WG5213> occasion <WG874> to glory <WG2745> on <WG5228> our <WG2257> behalf <WG5228>, that <WG2443> ye may have <WG2192> somewhat to <WG4314> answer them which glory <WG2744> in <WG1722> appearance <WG4383>, and <WG2532> not <WG3756> in heart <WG2588>. in appearance: Gr. in the face
For <WG1063> whether <WG1535> we be beside ourselves <WG1839>, it is to God <WG2316>: or whether <WG1535> we be sober <WG4993>, it is for your cause <WG5213>.

For <WG1063> the love <WG26> of Christ <WG5547> constraineth <WG4912> us <WG2248>; because we thus <WG5124> judge <WG2919>, that <WG3754> if <WG1487> one <WG1520> died <WG599> for <WG5228> all <WG3956>, then <WG686> were <WG599> all <WG3956> dead <WG599>:

And <WG2532> that he died <WG599> for <WG5228> all <WG3956>, that <WG2443> they which live <WG2198> should <WG2198> not henceforth <WG3371> live <WG2198> unto themselves <WG1438>, but <WG235> unto him which died <WG599> for <WG5228> them <WG846>, and <WG2532> rose again <WG1453>.

Wherefore <WG5620> henceforth <WG575> <WG3568> know <WG1492> we <WG2249> no man <WG3762> after <WG2596> the flesh <WG4561>: yea <WG1161>, though <WG1499> we have known <WG1097> Christ <WG5547> after <WG2596> the flesh <WG4561>, yet <WG235> now <WG3568> henceforth <WG3765> know we <WG1097> him no more <WG3765>.

Therefore <WG5620> if any man <WG1536> be in <WG1722> Christ <WG5547>, he is a new <WG2537> creature <WG2937>: old things <WG744> are passed away <WG3928>; behold <WG2400>, all things <WG3956> are become <WG1096> new <WG2537>. he is: or, let him be

And <WG1161> all things <WG3956> are of <WG1537> God <WG2316>, who <WG3588> hath reconciled <WG2644> us <WG2248> to himself <WG1438> by <WG1223> Jesus <WG2424> Christ <WG5547>, and <WG2532> hath given <WG1325> to us <WG2254> the ministry <WG1248> of reconciliation <WG2643>;

To wit <WG5613>, that <WG3754> God <WG2316> was <WG2258> in <WG1722> Christ <WG5547>, reconciling <WG2644> the world <WG2889> unto himself <WG1438>, not <WG3361> imputing <WG3049> their <WG846> trespasses <WG3900> unto them <WG846>; and <WG2532> hath committed <WG5087> unto <WG1722> us <WG2254> the word <WG3056> of reconciliation <WG2643>. committed: Gr. put in us

Now then <WG3767> we are ambassadors <WG4243> for <WG5228> Christ <WG5547>, as though <WG5613> God <WG2316> did beseech <WG3870> you by <WG1223> us <WG2257>: we pray <WG1189> you in <WG5228> Christ's <WG5547> stead <WG5228>, be ye reconciled <WG2644> to God <WG2316>.

For <WG1063> he hath made <WG4160> him to be sin <WG266> for <WG5228> us <WG2257>, who <WG3588> knew <WG1097> no <WG3361> sin <WG266>; that <WG2443> we <WG2249> might be made <WG1096> the righteousness <WG1343> of God <WG2316> in <WG1722> him <WG846>.
